arm_group.description: manually controlled infusion will be used
Target Controlled Infusion will be used

brief_summary.textblock:
test the following differences between Schinder's Target Controlled Infusion (TCI ) model
      and manually controlled infusion (MCI) :

        -  remifentanil and propofol total dose given

        -  incidence of awareness or inadequate anesthesia

        -  number of rescue dose given

clinical_study.brief_title: Total Intravenous Anesthesia: TCI Versus MCI
clinical_study.condition: Test the Differences Between Schinder's TCI Model and MCI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients undergoing breast or thyroid surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  BMI > 35

          -  Surgery shorter than 30 minutes

          -  Patients with history of: alcol or drug abuse, kidney or liver failure,
             cardiovascular disease

intervention.intervention_name: Remifentanil and propofol administration using TCI
Remifentanil and propofol administration using MCI

clinical_study.official_title: Total Intravenous Anesthesia: TCI Versus MCI, Unresolved Question

primary_outcome.measure: incidence of awareness or inadequate anesthesia
primary_outcome.time_frame: every 3 minutes till the end of surgery

reference.citation: Russell D. Intravenous anaesthesia: manual infusion schemes versus TCI systems. Anaesthesia. 1998 Apr;53 Suppl 1:42-5. Review.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: remifentanil and propofol total dose given
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes till the end of surgery

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
